column4: I just installed Ubuntu 9.04 on a new machine that has an Nvidia ION card in it. However, ubuntu didn't list the nvidia driver as a possible propri driver. Any ideas why ?
you can go here to check which drivers are suited for your nvidia ION card nvidia.com/object/unix.html
that means I have to install from nvidia drivers, and not ubuntu supported ones ?

there's no difference, the drivers offered by jockey-gtk or through the repos are the same drivers on the nvidia page, no modifications whatsoever.. the NVIDIA drivers are closed source, so they can't be modified
